name: akeylessExtensionAzdo
friendlyName: AKeyless Secrets Extension for Azure DevOps
description: An Azure DevOps extension to safely retrieve secrets from your AKeyless vault and create Pipeline secret variables.
author: Lance McCarthy

inputs.name: accessid
inputs.label: Access ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The access id of your auth method (ex: 'p-iwt13fd19ajd').

inputs.name: azureJwt
inputs.label: Azure JWT
inputs.helpMarkDown: The JWT token generated by your Azure service principal.

inputs.name: staticSecrets
inputs.label: Static Secrets
inputs.helpMarkDown: Static secrets to fetch from AKeyless. This needs to be a dictionary, with the secret's path as the key and the desired output name as the value. Example: {"/path/to/static/secret":"my_first_secret", "/path/to/another/secret":"my_second_secret"}

inputs.name: dynamicSecrets
inputs.label: Dynamic Secrets
inputs.helpMarkDown: Dynamic secrets to fetch from AKeyless. This needs to be a dictionary, with the secret's path as the key and the desired output name as the value. Example: {"/path/to/dynamic/secret":"my_dynamic_secret"}

inputs.name: exportSecretsToOutputs
inputs.label: Export Secrets To Outputs
inputs.helpMarkDown: True/False to denote if static/dynamic secrets should be exported as action outputs.

inputs.name: exportSecretsToEnvironment
inputs.label: Export Secrets To Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown: True/False to denote if static/dynamic secrets should be exported as environment variables.

inputs.name: parseDynamicSecrets
inputs.label: Parse Dynamic Secrets
inputs.helpMarkDown: True/False to denote if dynamic secrets will exported as a single object, or parsed into individual outputs/env variables. Please visit the demos in ci.yml for clarification.
